text: Lorin Varencove Maazel (March 6, 1930 – July 13, 2014) was an American conductor, violinist and composer. == Early life == Maazel was born to Jewish American parents of Russian origin in Neuilly-sur-Seine, France. His father, Lincoln Maazel, was also a conductor. == Career == In 1960, Maazel became the first American to conduct at the Bayreuth Festspielhaus. He was chief conductor of the Deutsche Oper Berlin from 1965 to 1971 and the Radio- Symphonie-Orchester (RSO) Berlin from 1964 to 1975. == Death == He died aged 84 on July 13, 2014, his Castleton Farms estate in Virginia, from complications of pneumonia. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American composers Category:American conductors Category:American violinists Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Musicians from Île-de-France Category:Musicians from Pittsburgh Category:People from Hauts-de-Seine
